Author: bishop#9773
Content: @BlackJesus I think I read earlier that you said the burden of proof is on the IRS, no, it most certainly is not. One of the few entities where they can say something and if it's wrong, the burden is on the taxpayer to prove it.

Author: bishop#9773
Content: it's very true that their budget is shrinking but the IRS is outsourcing a lot of the wallet stuff to Chainalysis

Author: bishop#9773
Content: sure obscure alts won't be high on the list but the blockchain is your written record so they have all the time in the world to link addresses and tie in meta

Author: bishop#9773
Content: but considering the bulk of trading happens on KYC, half the work is already done

Author: bishop#9773
Content: but in actuality, the IRS really does need to clarify numerous scenarios since their 2014 guidance
